agency_desc: A non-profit community Christian outreach providing guidance through instruction, education, and provision of food.
service_description: Provides various types of food to those in need. Toilet paper and personal grooming supplies may also be available. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Living within Warrick County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or walk in.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a variety of services for area seniors and people with disabilities.
service_description: Offers activities for area seniors, including special interest classes, social activities, day trips, arts and crafts, and games.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -OR- with a disability of any age

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including counseling services and support groups.
service_description: Offers faith-based support groups covering a variety of issues such as parenting, marriage counseling, addictions, veterans issues, adoption support, and other topics.
taxonomy_name: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups
nameLevel5: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups
site_details: Visit website or call for meeting schedule or for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Warrick County

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Provides treatment for pediatric minor illnesses and injuries. Adults are not seen at this location.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care. Patient information and support services are available for families of admitted patients. This hospital serves an intensive pediatric unit partnered with Indiana University Riley Hospital.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care for women and infants.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care or call for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Classes: Varies; call for schedule
Registration: Mon-Fri 8am-1pm -- Online Support: Daily 24 hours (once registered)
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers acute medical care for heart and vascular needs.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Warrick County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit offering youth enrichment services for the local community.
service_description: Provides a faith-based after-school and summer youth program for grade-school aged children.  Programs include  tutoring, social activities, spiritual activities, games, and an evening meal. Summer camp is also available.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF WARRICK COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit faith-based housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Warrick County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF WARRICK COUNTY
service_description: Sells donated building supplies, used appliances, and other home items to the general public at a discount. Donations accepted during store hours or by arrangement. Pickup is available for large-item donations within set boundaries.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a no-kill animal shelter and animal care services.
service_description: Provides a no-kill shelter for stray and unwanted animals in Warrick County and re-homes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services, micro-chipping of pets, and accepts surrendered animals from Warrick County residents.
site_details: To adopt or view lost-and-found animals: Walk in, or visit the website. -- To surrender a pet: Call to schedule appointment to complete paperwork.
site_eligibility: To Surrender: Living in Warrick County -- All Other Services: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food and clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Perishable food, toiletries, and household goods are available, based on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Drive around to the back of the building and enter through Door 4.
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry during the previous 30 days.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: NEWBURGH CHANDLER PUBLIC LIBRARY - BELL ROAD BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call or visit the website for information. www.ncplibraries.org
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Warrick County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: NEWBURGH CHANDLER PUBLIC LIBRARY - CHANDLER BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call or visit the website for information. www.ncplibraries.org
site_schedule: Tues 11am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 10-5pm; and Sat 9am-5pm
Tues 11am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 10-5pm; and Sat 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Warrick County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: NEWBURGH CHANDLER PUBLIC LIBRARY - DOWNTOWN BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call or visit the website for information. www.ncplibraries.org
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Warrick County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit providing a soup kitchen to all in need.
site_name: WARRICK ECUMENICAL SOUP KITCHEN AT SAINT CLEMENT CATHOLIC CHURCH
service_description: Provides a hot meal for all in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: SAINT JOHN THE BAPTIST CATHOLIC PARISH
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a thrift store.
site_name: SAINT JOHN THE BAPTIST CATHOLIC PARISH
service_description: Sells new and gently used clothing, toys, household goods, appliances, and furniture at discounted prices. Selection varies by donations.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food and clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides a food and clothing to individuals and families in need. Clients may return once per month to receive assistance. By appointment only.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- One visit allowed every 30 days

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Boonville in Warrick County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Boonville in Warrick County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Warrick County dispatch after hours.
site_schedule: Office/Station: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm -- Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Boonville in Warrick County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Warrick County.
service_description: Maintains the Warrick County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by a parent or guardian who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
service_description: Offers a private, full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care. Patient information and support services are available for families of admitted patients.
site_details:
?For emergency care: Walk in. 
?For billing and financial assistance: Call the Billing Services office. 
?For physician referrals: Call the Physician Referral Line.
?For all other services, including patient information: Call the switchboard.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
service_description: Offers immediate care for minor injuries and illness, including sore throats, ear infections, colds, flu, pink eye, asthma, sinus infections, allergies, and rashes.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial psychiatric and chemical dependency hospital whose mission is "to change peoples lives by delivering innovative and evidence-based treatment in a professional and compassionate environment that creates a foundation for long term healing and recovery."
service_description: Provides inpatient and outpatient mental health services for adolescents and adults struggling with depression, anxiety, PTSD, borderline personality disorder, bipolar disorder, psychosis, and suicidal ideation. Additional services include emergency mental health services, Partial Hospitalization Programs (PHP), and Intensive Outpatient Programs (IOP). Some services offered virtually. Limited transportation to and from facility may be available.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Walk in or call for an initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 13 or older (adolescents age 13-17; adults age 18 or older) -- In need of inpatient or outpatient substance use services (based on clinical assessment)

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Warrick County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Warrick County. Offers court accompaniment services and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_schedule: Child Support Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Child Support Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Warrick County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to older adults and those who are disabled in a six county area.
site_name: SWIRCA & MORE MEAL SITE - NEWBURGH SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunches five days each week for area seniors. Reservations are not required. Small donation requested.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older (exceptions made for spouses and guests)

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Warrick County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 2nd and 4th Mon 4pm
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 2nd and 4th Mon 4pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Warrick County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Warrick County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Warrick County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Warrick County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Warrick County Courts

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Provides a program that assists persons at any income level to better manage their money and financial obligations. Counselors meet with clients on a one-on-one basis to create short- and long-term goals to reduce the amount of debt the client has and to create a plan to build savings and assets.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, Warrick, or Spencer County -- Additional requirements vary by program; call for information
